channel.title: Issue while try to log in some sites with Tor
channel.description: Hello When I try to log in in some sites and write correct captcha, the sites show always that it is not correct while when I use a clear ip I can log in.The sites don't block tor ip What is the issue?

item.title: Issue while try to log in some sites with Tor
item.dc:creator: entr0py
item.description:
kik0l1:

Before that I upgrade the Tor browser, it worked well

https://blog.torproject.org/blog/tor-browser-607-released

Here is the full changelog since 6.0.6:
    All Platforms
        Update Firefox to 45.5.1esr
        **Update NoScript to 2.9.5.2**
kik0l1:

Tried disabling noscript addon and works perfectly. What does it mean?

Try NoScript support: https://forums.informaction.com/viewforum.php?f=7

But it will be difficult for anyone to troubleshoot without knowing the site in question. At least would help to know which captcha mechanism you’re talking about.

Read full topic
item.source: Issue while try to log in some sites with Tor

item.title: Issue while try to log in some sites with Tor
item.dc:creator: Ego
item.description:
Good day,

Then I don’t really know what’s going on here. Usually Allowing Scripts globally should have the same effect as disabling the AddOn, though without changing the base fingerprint…

Either way, may I recommend to you asking this question on Stackexchange, as we don’t modify the Tor Browser Bundle in any way, shape or form anyways: http://tor.stackexchange.com

Have a nice day,

Ego

Read full topic
item.source: Issue while try to log in some sites with Tor

item.title: Issue while try to log in some sites with Tor
item.dc:creator: kik0l1
item.description:
There are two options:
Allow scripts globally (Dangerous)
Forbid scripts globally (Advised)

I have my browser set on allow scripts globally

Maybe is there anything in option menu that blocks it?

Read full topic
item.source: Issue while try to log in some sites with Tor

item.title: Issue while try to log in some sites with Tor
item.dc:creator: Ego
item.description:
Good day,

Are you certain you had JavaScript active before? Because usually NoScript is what is used to block JS and from the sounds of it, you hadn’t Enabled Global Scripts with it which is what caused this.

Have a nice day,

Ego

Read full topic

item.title: Issue while try to log in some sites with Tor
item.dc:creator: kik0l1
item.description:
I reload the connection many times but nothing of new happened
Tried disabling noscript addon and works perfectly. What does it mean?

Read full topic
item.source: Issue while try to log in some sites with Tor

item.title: Issue while try to log in some sites with Tor
item.dc:creator: Ego
item.description:
Good day,

If JS is active then NoScript shouldn’t have any effect. Also, I meant reloading the connection, not simply the page.

Have a nice day,

Ego

Read full topic

item.title: Issue while try to log in some sites with Tor
item.dc:creator: kik0l1
item.description:
Hi
My Javascript is always active. Tried to reload the page but the issue isn’t solved
Before that I upgrade the Tor browser, it worked well

Read full topic
item.source: Issue while try to log in some sites with Tor

item.title: Issue while try to log in some sites with Tor
item.dc:creator: Ego
item.description:
Good day,

Usually reloading the connection should help. Also, in some cases, sadly, activating JavaScript is necessary due to the way some “DDOS-Protection-Services” are designed.

Have a nice day,

Ego

Read full topic
